title: Eastern Shore Fire Destroys Home; Kills Two Cats
body: PITTSVILLE, MD (WBFF) - An investigation is underway after a large fire ravaged and destroyed a one story, single family home on the Eastern Shore Friday afternoon.The fire broke out just before noon in  34600 block of Heartland Drive in Pittsville.The Pittsville Volunteer Fire Department in addition to several other companies in the area responded to the 2 alarm blaze.In total 45 firefighters responded and took approximately 90 minutes to contain.The fire was firs reported by a neighbor, the occupants of the house were able to escape unharmed.Unfortunately, two cats perished in the fire.Smoke detectors were present and functional in the home.The fire caused a total estimated loss of $300,000.Investigators with the State's Fire Marshal cleared the scene and were able to determine the fire started in the home's bedroom.The official cause is still under investigation.
